body_html:
It seems you're building from within your model directory as opposed to building in the TensorFlow source directory.

Alternatively, if you want to avoid building TensorFlow from source, you could use the library function directly using something like:

from tensorflow.python.tools.strip_unused import strip_unused_lib

help(strip_unused_lib.strip_unused_from_files)

Which is what is being invoked by the tool

Since this issue doesn't correspond to a bug, I'm going to close it. If you need more help, I'd recommend asking on StackOverflow since it is not a bug or feature request. There is also a larger community that reads questions there. Thanks!

from tensorflow.python.tools.strip_unused import strip_unused_lib

Which is what is being invoked by the tool
Since this issue doesn't correspond to a bug, I'm going to close it. If you need more help, I'd recommend asking on  StackOverflow since it is not a  bug or feature request. There is also a larger community that reads questions there. Thanks!
body:
It seems you're building from within your model directory as opposed to building in the TensorFlow source directory.

Alternatively, if you want to avoid building TensorFlow from source, you could use the library function directly using something like:

```python
from tensorflow.python.tools.strip_unused import strip_unused_lib

help(strip_unused_lib.strip_unused_from_files)
```

Which is [what is being invoked by the tool](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r1.3/tensorflow/python/tools/strip_unused.py#L55)

Since this issue doesn't correspond to a bug, I'm going to close it. If you need more help, I'd recommend asking on  [StackOverflow](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/tensorflow) since it is not a  bug or feature request. There is also a larger community that reads questions there. Thanks!
